page.title: 16A Survey of our Class<contd>
page.content: e person had four. Out of thirty people, fourteen had one car, ten had two cars, and one had four cars. Five children in our class had no car at all. We also surveyed the jobs which our fathers and mothers do. We found that 68% of our fathers were in a profession, whilst the rest were in wage earning jobs. There was no unemployment amongst our fathers at all. The job patterns of our mothers was a complete reversal of this trend. 34% were in a profession, whilst the remainder were in jobs. For the purpose of this survey we counted being a housewife as a job rather than a profession. One mum said it was more of a vocation than anything else!
